meanings.definition: To recruit (someone) for a job or position by approaching them directly.
meanings.sent1: The company headhunted a talented engineer for their new project.
meanings.sent2: She was headhunted by a rival firm for her exceptional skills.
meanings.sent3: The tech company headhunted a coding genius who could type with their eyes closed!
meanings.sent4: The sports team headhunted a star player to lead them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The detective headhunted the best investigator in town to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To seek out and recruit (someone) for a job or position.
meanings.sent1: They headhunted a top chef to work at their restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer was headhunted by a prestigious fashion house.
meanings.sent3: The zoo headhunted a panda expert to help with their new exhibit.
meanings.sent4: The music producer headhunted a talented singer for their latest album.
meanings.sent5: The university headhunted a renowned professor to join their faculty.
